Detailed Description

This class is the manager which arbitrates interaction between applications and the current input method.

The following example demonstrates how to use the InputMethodManager class. 

 #include <gaia/service/InputMethodManager.h>

 using namespace gaia::service;

 InputMethodManager* pImm = new InputMethodManager();
 pImm->showSoftInput(TextWidget);

 delete pImm;

Definition at line 39 of file InputMethodManager.h.

virtual base::Vector<InputMethodInfo*> gaia::service::InputMethodManager::getEnabledInputMethodListN ( ) const [virtual]

Return the current enabled input methods.

Returns:
A list of input methods which are enabled in system.

Return the support input methods.

Returns:
A list of all input methods in system.

Hide input method.

Parameters:

True if the soft input is hidden, false otherwise.

Returns:
True if the widget is active, false otherwise.
virtual bool gaia::service::InputMethodManager::isFullscreenMode ( ) [virtual]

Return true if the current input method is running in fullscreen mode.

Returns:
True if the soft input mode is fullscreen, false otherwise.
virtual void gaia::service::InputMethodManager::restartInput ( const gaia::core::Widget &  widget) [virtual]

Restart input method by the given widget, if the given widget is connected with input method currently.

You should call this when the text within your widget changes outside of the normal input method or key input flow.

Parameters:
[in]widgetThe widget whose text has changed.
virtual void gaia::service::InputMethodManager::sendPickerBroadcast ( gaia::core::Context *  context) [virtual]

Send a broadcast intent to open the input method picker.

This is as same as taping on the notify on notification bar.

Parameters:
[in]contextThe context which is sending the broadcast.
virtual void gaia::service::InputMethodManager::setInputMethod ( gaia::core::IBinder *  token,
const gaia::base::String &  id 
) [virtual]

Force switch to a new input method component.

This can only be called from the currently active input method, as validated by the given token.

Parameters:
[in]tokenSupplies the identifying token given to an input method when it was started, which allows it to perform this operation on itself.
[in]idThe unique identifier for the new input method to be switched to.
virtual bool gaia::service::InputMethodManager::setInputMethodEnabled ( const gaia::base::String &  id,
bool  enabled 
) [virtual]

Enable/Disable the input method.

Parameters:
[in]idThe unique identifier for the input method to be enabled.
[in]enabledSet true to add the input method to enabled list.

Show input method.
